results.title: Hangman
results.creator_credit: Les Goldman, Paul Julian and Melrose Productions
results.brief_description: Follows Maurice Ogden’s allegorical poem. A hangman executes the inhabitants of a tow, one by one, without explanation. Fed by the blood of the victims no-one defended - the alien, the one who dared to object, and the Jew - the gallows tree takes root and fills the village square. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Hands, knees and bumps-a-daisy
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board and TV Cartoons
results.brief_description: A short and amusing animated industrial safety film in which Stanley Unwin exhorts his audience to safeguard themselves against injury in their work by wearing the protective gloves and knee-pads provided. Also considers the hazards of working in mines.

results.title: Handling dangerous chemicals: bases
results.brief_description: Explains the characteristics of bases, the solubility of sodium hydroxide pellets in the air, proper techniques for dissolving solid bases in water and stoppering reagent bottles.

results.title: Handling dangerous chemicals: acids
results.brief_description: Shows the viscosity of concentrated acids, effects of nitric hydrochloric and sulphuric acids on skin and on clothing. Demonstrates the proper techniques for diluting concentrated acids and the use of emergency fountains to flush acids from the face and eyes.
results.description: Shows the viscosity of concentrated acids, effects of nitric hydrochloric and sulphuric acids on skin and on clothing. Demonstrates the proper techniques for diluting concentrated acids and the use of emergency fountains to flush acids from the face and eyes.

results.title: Hamam: the Turkish bath
results.creator_credit: Ferzan Ozpetec, Marco Risi, Maurizio Tedesco and Sorpasso Film
results.brief_description: This Italian-Turkish co-production is the story of a successful Italian businessman, Francesco, who goes to Istanbul to settle the estate of his estranged Aunt. In Turkey he encounters his Aunt’s surrogate family and decides to stay on in Istanbul and restore an old hamam (Turkish bath). Francesco finds that not only is he attracted to the generosity of his new “family”, he also finds himself sexually attracted to the son, Mehmet. When his wife Marta arrives from Italy they find themselves locked in a bitter exchange that strips bare the lies and evasions that underpin their marriage. For both Marta and Francesco, the city of Istanbul - half European, half Asian - comes to symbolise a freedom, a romance and a community that is no longer available in the fast-paced materialistic culture of Western Europe. And for both of them, with the destruction of their marriage and the intervention of violent tragedy, they discover themselves recreating the Aunt’s original exile. Filmed in location in Istanbul, this is the first film of Turkish director Ferzan Ozpetac. Cast includes Allessandro Gassman and Francesca d’Aloja. In Italian and Turkish with English subtitles. (Awards: Winner of two Golden Globe Awards for Best First Film and for Best Musical Score)

results.title: Hallmarking
results.creator_credit: Andrew Holmes, Jack Holmes, Goldsmith's Company of London and Kenneth Myer Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of hall-marking and the evolution of different marks. Hall-marks represent a guarantee of quality and are based on stringent tests. Shows modern gold and silverware being tested at the London Assay Office. The different stages in the analysis are seen in detail.
